images.alt: People comfort each other near the scene of Wednesday's mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, California.
Image: Alexander Smith of NBC News.
Image: Alastair Jamieson of NBC News.

info.description: A mass shooting at the Borderline Bar and Grill in Thousand Oaks, California, ended with at least 11 people killed. The shooter was also confirmed dead.
info.title: Mass shooting at Borderline Bar and Grill in Thousand Oaks, California

twitter.description: Several hundred people were inside the venue at the time, police said. The gunman later was confirmed dead.
twitter.title: 12 victims killed, suspect dead after mass shooting at California bar

text.markdown:
Nov. 8, 2018 / 8:39 AM GMT / Updated 2:10 PM GMT

By Alexander Smith, Pete Williams, Andrew Blankstein and Alastair Jamieson

Twelve people including a police officer were killed by a gunman at a crowded bar in Thousand Oaks, California, late Wednesday, officials said.

Several hundred people were inside the venue, which was hosting a "college country night" for students, police said. Ventura County Sheriff Geoff Dean described the incident at the Borderline Bar and Grill as a "tragic, tragic situation."

## ['I'm scared:' Eyewitness describes seeing shooter inside Borderline Bar](https://www.msnbc.com/morning-joe/watch/eyewitness-inside-borderline-bar-at-thousand-oaks-calif-1364962883812)

Nov. 8, 201801:49

[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.msnbc.com/morning-joe/watch/eyewitness-inside-borderline-bar-at-thousand-oaks-calif-1364962883812)[](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text='I'm scared:' Eyewitness describes seeing shooter inside Borderline Bar&via=nbcnews&url=https://www.msnbc.com/morning-joe/watch/eyewitness-inside-borderline-bar-at-thousand-oaks-calif-1364962883812&original_referer=https://www.msnbc.com/morning-joe/watch/eyewitness-inside-borderline-bar-at-thousand-oaks-calif-1364962883812)[](mailto:?subject=Eyewitness inside Borderline Bar at Thousand Oaks, Calif.&body=https://www.msnbc.com/morning-joe/watch/eyewitness-inside-borderline-bar-at-thousand-oaks-calif-1364962883812)

Authorities confirmed that the shooter had been killed and Dean said it was too early to determine whether there was any link to terrorism.

Law enforcement officials say they have a tentative identification, but they're not yet revealing the name. The gunman is a 29-year-old white male, who is heavily tattooed, several sources said.

Dean said on "Today" that that investigators were seeking to identify him using fingerprints and tattoos.

The identification process has been slower than normal, because the gunman, armed with a single handgun, was apparently not carrying a driver's license or any other form of ID.

President Donald Trump [sent two tweets](https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1060515116700045312) paying tributes to the authorities and victims. He praised the "great bravery shown by police" and said "God bless all of the victims and families of the victims."

The police officer killed was named as Sgt. Ron Helus, a 29-year police veteran with a wife and son who was looking to retire in the next year.

"He was hard-working, he was totally committed, he gave his all and, tonight, as I told his wife, he died a hero," an emotional Dean said. "He gave his life to save other people."


Helus, 54, arrived at the scene alongside a colleague from the California Highway Patrol within three minutes of reports of shots being fired at around 11:20 p.m. (2:20 a.m. ET Thursday), according to Dean.

After hearing more gunfire, Helus and the Highway Patrol officer entered the building and Helus "was struck multiple times with gunfire," according to Dean.

## [Sergeant killed in Thousand Oaks shooting was 'hero,' sheriff says](https://www.today.com/video/sergeant-killed-in-thousand-oaks-shooting-was-hero-sheriff-says-1365023811908)

Nov. 8, 201804:55

[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.today.com/video/sergeant-killed-in-thousand-oaks-shooting-was-hero-sheriff-says-1365023811908)[](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Sergeant killed in Thousand Oaks shooting was 'hero,' sheriff says&via=nbcnews&url=https://www.today.com/video/sergeant-killed-in-thousand-oaks-shooting-was-hero-sheriff-says-1365023811908&original_referer=https://www.today.com/video/sergeant-killed-in-thousand-oaks-shooting-was-hero-sheriff-says-1365023811908)[](mailto:?subject=Sergeant killed in Thousand Oaks shooting was ‘hero,’ sheriff says&body=https://www.today.com/video/sergeant-killed-in-thousand-oaks-shooting-was-hero-sheriff-says-1365023811908)

The other officer went back into the building and dragged Helus out of the line of fire, but he died in the hospital hours later, the sheriff said.

A SWAT team, FBI and others officers arrived soon after. When they entered the building they found 11 people dead.

"They found people hiding in restrooms, people hiding in attics," Dean said. Other witnesses described people using bar stools to break windows and escape. "It's a horrific scene in there, there's blood everywhere."

A single shooter was also found killed by a gunshot wound, Dean said, adding that it was unclear exactly who had killed the suspect. "We don't know who shot anybody at this point," he said.

![People comfort each other near the scene of Wednesday's mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, California.](https://media2.s-nbcnews.com/j/newscms/2018_45/2638381/181108-thousand-oaks-shooting-mc-1037_8198b6342cd368530a8d82d99f18471e.fit-760w.JPG)People comfort each other near the scene of Wednesday's mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, California.Mark J. Terrill / AP

Between 10 and 12 people suffered injuries of varying severity, others with more minor wounds escaping and taking themselves to the hospital, Dean added.

Pepperdine University, in nearby Malibu, said it believed some of its students were at the bar. It said it was working "to identify and provide support to those students."

Located around 40 miles west of Los Angeles, Thousand Oaks was recently ranked as one of the country's safest cities.

"I've been a cop for 41 years," Dean said. "But I've learned it doesn't matter what community you're in, it doesn’t matter how safe your community is, it can happen anywhere."

John Hedge told NBC News he and his stepdad were in the bar and were forced to take cover when the shooting started.

"I was actually about to leave when you start hearing pop, pop, pop. It sounded like fireworks or something," he said. "My stepdad dove and took cover and yelled at me, 'John, hit the deck! Hide!' So I get down. And the gunman started opening fire on the cashiers, the people working the cash register on the front desk."

## [Thousand Oaks bar shooting suspect not yet identified](https://www.today.com/video/thousand-oaks-bar-shooting-suspect-not-yet-identified-1365023811652)

Nov. 8, 201801:40

[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.today.com/video/thousand-oaks-bar-shooting-suspect-not-yet-identified-1365023811652)[](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Thousand Oaks bar shooting suspect not yet identified&via=nbcnews&url=https://www.today.com/video/thousand-oaks-bar-shooting-suspect-not-yet-identified-1365023811652&original_referer=https://www.today.com/video/thousand-oaks-bar-shooting-suspect-not-yet-identified-1365023811652)[](mailto:?subject=Thousand Oaks bar shooting suspect not yet identified&body=https://www.today.com/video/thousand-oaks-bar-shooting-suspect-not-yet-identified-1365023811652)

Kayla Simmons said she was inside the bar when shots were fired directly behind her. Bullets continued as she managed to escape outside into the parking lot.

"I saw the shots go off, although I didn’t really see the guy," she said. "I knew something was wrong straight away. I just wanted to get down as soon as I heard the first shot go off."

Hours after the shooting stopped, friends and family members gathered at the nearby Goebel Senior Center and waited anxiously for news.

Among them was Ken Dunham, whose son Jake, 21, was in the bar and remains missing.

"I keep calling it but there’s no answer," he told NBC Los Angeles. "It just keeps ringing out. And he always answers his phone."

He said he was alerted to the shooting by his son’s friends who raced to the house and banged on his door.

One college student who said he was a regular at the Borderline told the channel he had at least 10 friends inside.

"No one's gotten back to me," he said on camera without giving his name. "I'd like to hope for the best, but I have no idea."

The venue opened in 1993 and describes itself as a "haven for country line dancing folks of all ages." It says it's hosted many famous acts including The Beach Boys.

Thousand Oaks was ranked the third-safest city in the United States this year, according to [the data analysis website Niche](https://www.niche.com/places-to-live/search/safest-cities/).

It is the 307th mass shooting in the United States this year, [according to the Gun Violence Archive](https://www.gunviolencearchive.org/reports/mass-shooting).

 _This is a breaking news story. Please check back for updates._

![Image: Alexander Smith of NBC News.](https://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_37/312416/byline-smith_fd5a7842e708d00a0364b2729d31ff8d.jpg) Alexander Smith[](https://twitter.com/AlexSmithNBC)[](https://facebook.com/https://www.facebook.com/alexsmithnbc)[](mailto:alexander.smith@nbcuni.com)

Alexander Smith is a senior reporter for NBC News, based in London.

![](https://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_04/128581/140116-byline-pete-williams-sq-_j4a8923_01e1e218220517b62b932da1192c4601.jpg)Pete Williams[](https://twitter.com/petewilliamsnbc)

Pete Williams is an NBC News correspondent who covers the Justice Department and the Supreme Court, based in Washington.

Andrew Blankstein[](https://twitter.com/anblanx)[](https://facebook.com/https://www.facebook.com/NBCInvestigates?ref=hl)[](mailto:andrew.blankstein@nbcuni.com)

Andrew Blankstein is an investigative reporter for NBC News. He covers the Western United States, specializing in crime, courts and homeland security. 

![Image: Alastair Jamieson of NBC News.](https://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_15/312426/byline-jamieson_09a54028fbf573d26afe6720ff4bc832.jpg)Alastair Jamieson[](https://twitter.com/alastairjam)[](https://facebook.com/https://www.facebook.com/alastair.jamieson.9)[](mailto:alastair.jamieson@nbcuni.com)

Alastair Jamieson is a London-based reporter, editor and homepage producer for NBC News.

Kurt Chirbas, Caitlin Fichtel and Saphora Smith contributed.

By Alexander Smith, Pete Williams, Andrew Blankstein and Alastair Jamieson
Twelve people including a police officer were killed by a gunman at a crowded bar in Thousand Oaks, California, late Wednesday, officials said.
Several hundred people were inside the venue, which was hosting a "college country night" for students, police said. Ventura County Sheriff Geoff Dean described the incident at the Borderline Bar and Grill as a "tragic, tragic situation."

Authorities confirmed that the shooter had been killed and Dean said it was too early to determine whether there was any link to terrorism.

Helus, 54, arrived at the scene alongside a colleague from the California Highway Patrol within three minutes of reports of shots being fired at around 11:20 p.m. (2:20 a.m. ET Thursday), according to Dean.
After hearing more gunfire, Helus and the Highway Patrol officer entered the building and Helus "was struck multiple times with gunfire," according to Dean.

A single shooter was also found killed by a gunshot wound, Dean said, adding that it was unclear exactly who had killed the suspect. "We don't know who shot anybody at this point," he said.

So I get down. And the gunman started opening fire on the cashiers, the people working the cash register on the front desk."
